Perbandingan Statistik Shin Tae-yong Vs Luis Milla, Siapa yang Cocok Latih Timnas Indonesia?
07 Nov 2019, 10:45 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Simon McMenemy sudah resmi diberhentikan dari kursi pelatih Timnas Indonesia. PSSI memutuskan mendepak Simon menyusul kegagalan Tim Garuda pada kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022.
Partai kontra Timnas Malaysia di penyisihan Grup G putaran kedua kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 zona Asia, akan jadi laga terakhir sekaligus perpisahan pelatih asal Skotlandia itu bersama Timnas Indonesia.
Pertandingan kelima Timnas Indonesia di penyisihan Grup G putaran kedua kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 zona Asia ini akan digelar di Stadion Nasional, Bukit Jalil, Malaysia, 19 November 2019.
Dari tujuh pertandingan yang dijalani, Timnas Indonesia di bawah asuhan Simon hanya berhasil memenangi dua pertandingan yakni kala melawan Myanmar dengan skor 2-0 dan melawan Vanuatu dengan skor 6-0. Sayangnya, kemenangan tersebut dicatatkan dalam laga uji coba.
Setelahnya, Timnas Indonsia terus mengalami keterpurukan. Dalam laga kualifikasi, Andrytani dan kawan-kawan belum pernah menang.
Terbaru, pada Rabu, (6/11/2019), PSSI mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Simon atas kerja samanya selama ini. Itu artinya, pelatih berusia 41 tahun itu tak lama lagi angkat kaki dari kursi kepengurusan Timnas.
“Kami mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Simon atas kerja samanya selama ini. Semoga laga melawan Malaysia, kita mendapatkan hasil yang positif,” kata Ketua Umum PSSI Mochamad Iriawan mengutip dari Twitter PSSI.
Pemecatan Simon McMenemy tak lantas membuat pria asal Skotlandia itu meninggalkan Timnas Indonesia. Setidaknya, Simon masih akan mendampingi Indonesia menghadapi Malaysia di stadion Bukit Jalil pada 19 November 2019.
PSSI disebut telah menyiapkan dua nama bakal pengganti Simon McMenemy. Dua nama tersebut adalah Luis Milla dan mantan pelatih Korea Selatan, Shin Tae-yong.

Comparison of Statistics of Shin Tae-yong vs Luis Milla, Who Is Suitable to Train the Indonesian National Team?
Nov 7 2019, 10:45 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Simon McMenemy has been officially dismissed from the Indonesian national team coach seat. PSSI decided to eject Simon following the failure of the Garuda Team in the 2022 World Cup qualifiers.
The Malaysian counter-national team in the qualification for Group G in the second round of the 2022 World Cup qualifying zone in Asia, will be the last match as well as the farewell of the Scottish coach with the Indonesian national team.
The fifth match of the Indonesian national team in the elimination of Group G in the second round of the 2022 World Cup qualifying Asian zone will be held at the National Stadium, Bukit Jalil, Malaysia, November 19, 2019.
Of the seven matches that were undertaken, the Indonesian national team under the tutelage of Simon only managed to win two matches namely when against Myanmar with a score of 2-0 and against Vanuatu with a score of 6-0. Unfortunately, the victory was recorded in a trial match.
Afterwards, the Indonesian National Team continued to experience slumps. In the qualifying match, Andrytani and his friends have never won.
Most recently, on Wednesday (11/06/2019), PSSI thanked Simon for his cooperation so far. That means, the 41-year-old trainer will soon be leaving the national team chair.
"We thank Simon for the cooperation so far. Hopefully the game against Malaysia, we will get positive results, "PSSI Chairman Mochamad Iriawan quoted from PSSI Twitter.
The dismissal of Simon McMenemy did not necessarily make the Scottish man leave the Indonesian National Team. At the very least, Simon will still accompany Indonesia to face Malaysia in the Bukit Jalil stadium on November 19, 2019.
PSSI is said to have prepared two names for Simon McMenemy's successor. The two names are Luis Milla and former South Korean coach, Shin Tae-yong.
